translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Tamāla-Flower Similes
The Elder Kisalayapūjaka’s Birth Story
“In the city of Dvāravatī,
I was a garland maker.
And there was a well

analyzed: pāda pānam virohano  sabalena upatthaddhaḥ  siddhatthaḥ aparājitaḥ
translated: with a tree growing at the edge.🔽The Victorious One, the Invincible One,
the One with Complete Accomplishment,🔽was attended by Sāriputta.
He was going along without faltering.
I saw nothing else
that was suitable for worship of the Great Sage.
Seeing a leaf that was without thorns,
I raised it up in the sky.
Those leaves of the kisalava tree
followed the Buddha as he went.
Seeing them, I was inspired:
‘How very precious the Buddha is!’
For ninety-four eons
I raised up that leaf.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Thirty-seven eons ago,
I was a sole monarch.
Endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical insights …
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kisalayapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kisalayapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Kisalayapūjaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Kisalayapūjaka is finished.
